text: Imagination is the beginning of creation.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Never let your memories be greater than your dreams.
author: Doug Ivester

text: At first dreams seem impossible, then improbable, then inevitable.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Nothing is more creative...nor destructive...than a brilliant mind with a purpose.
author: Dan Brown

text: By seeking and blundering we learn.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: If you chase two rabbits, you catch none.
author: Confucius

text: I don't pretend to know everything; I just only speak on matters I know I'll win.
author: Criss Jami

text: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: Be not afraid of growing slowly, be afraid only of standing still.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Being a good example is the best form of service.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: You can't let your failures define you. You have to let your failures teach you.
author: Barack Obama

text: The more you are grateful for what you have the more you will have to be grateful for.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The biggest challenge after success is shutting up about it.
author: Criss Jami

text: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
author: Epictetus

text: Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
author: Woody Allen

text: Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for.
author: Bob Marley

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Life is not just the passing of time. Life is the collection of experiences and their intensity.
author: Jim Rohn

text: No experience is a cause of success or failure. We do not suffer from the shock of our experiences, so-called trauma – but we make out of them just what suits our purposes.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.
author: Zen Proverb

text: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
author: Walt Disney

text: Have the fearless attitude of a hero and the loving heart of a child.
author: Soyen Shaku

text: The first rule of business; treat others like they want to treat you.
author: Charles Dickens

text: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
author: Woody Allen

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Changing minds is harder than finding people who already agree.
author: Jack Butcher

text: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: You are what you do, not what you say you'll do.
author: Carl Jung

text: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
author: Brian Tracy

text: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

text: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.
author: Criss Jami

text: What's obvious to you isn't obvious to most people. Operate from this perspective and you'll help more people.
author: Jack Butcher

text: The decisions of our past are the architects of our present.
author: Dan Brown

text: The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Don't seek, don't avoid, don't expect. Take what comes and be happy.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
author: Alexander Pope

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Every one of us is the sum total of his own thoughts.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: You cannot change your destination overnight but you can change your direction overnight.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Mastery is not a function of genius or talent, it is a function of time and intense focus applied to a particular field of knowledge.
author: Robert Greene

text: Would you rather learn to deal with the truth now than be forced to do so later on?
author: Celestine Chua

text: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
author: James Allen

text: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
author: Charles Spurgeon

text: As mortals, we're ruled by conditions, not by ourselves.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Your neighbor is the man who needs you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: When you view failure as feedback, you get more done. When you view failure as a finality, you get nothing done.
author: Jack Butcher

text: Don't look for meaning in the words. Listen to the silences.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Give credit where credit is due: simply said, if you want loyalty and best effort, you must be thoughtful.
author: Estee Lauder

text: You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Life is but one dream flowing into another.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Don't be afraid to go slowly. Be afraid of stopping.
author: Zen Proverb

text: As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Rohn

text: It is what we make out of what we have, not what we are given, that separates one person from another.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: In peace, sons bury their fathers. In war, fathers bury their sons.
author: Herodotus

text: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

text: Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.
author: Og Mandino

text: I take the position that I'm always to some degree wrong, and the aspiration is to be less wrong.
author: Elon Musk

text: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.
author: Epictetus

text: Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.
author: Dan Brown

text: First comes the shy wish. Then you must have the heart to have the dream. Then, you work, and work.
author: Estee Lauder

text: Among the things you can give and still keep are your word, a smile, and a grateful heart.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The most virtuous are those who content themselves with being virtuous without seeking to appear so.
author: Plato

text: Do not look for a sanctuary in anyone except your self.
author: Buddha

text: A good character is the best tombstone. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.
author: Charles Spurgeon

text: The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: The giving of love is an education in itself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Hope and fear come from feeling that we lack something; they come from a sense of poverty.
author: Pema Chodron

text: I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: The mirror is a worthless invention. The only way to truly see yourself is in the reflection of someone elses. eyes.
author: Voltaire

text: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach.
author: Benjamin Mays

text: Change begets change. Nothing propagates so fast.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
author: Og Mandino

text: I can think of nothing less pleasurable than a life devoted to pleasure.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: All know the way; few actually walk it.
author: Bodhidharma

text: The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.
author: Colin Powell

text: The health of nations is more important than the wealth of nations.
author: Will Rogers

text: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

text: Make your stand today. On this spot. On this day.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Humans and prosperity never endure side by side for long.
author: Herodotus

text: To a mind that is still, the entire universe surrenders.
author: Zhuangzi

text: We have to walk in a way that we only print peace and serenity on the Earth. Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: All happiness depends on courage and work.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
author: Voltaire

text: A path is made by walking on it.
author: Zhuangzi

text: The significance of life is living.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

text: We create the world and ourselves;
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.
author: Rita Mae Brown

text: Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.
author: James Allen

text: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Friends ask you questions; enemies question you.
author: Criss Jami

text: If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.
author: James Cameron

text: None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Life is like playing the violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
author: Samuel Butler

text: A thing must be loved before it is lovable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.
author: Will Rogers

text: To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.
author: Conrad Hilton

text: Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.
author: Elon Musk

text: Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: A Quitter never wins – and – a Winner never quits.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Nothing has any power over me other than that which I give it through my conscious thoughts.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.
author: Rumi

text: When you know what you want, and want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: You have as much laughter as you have faith.
author: Martin Luther

text: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
author: Zhuangzi

text: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Always show more kindness than seems necessary because the person receiving it needs it more than you will ever know.
author: Colin Powell

text: When you want to be honored by others, you learn to honor them first.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: The biggest mistake we could ever make in our lives is to think we work for anybody but ourselves.
author: Brian Tracy

text: The grass is greener where you water it.
author: Neil Barringham

text: Work is always an antidote to depression.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: For things to change, you have to change.
author: Jim Rohn

text: I would rather die on my feet than live on my knees.
author: Euripides

text: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
author: James Allen

text: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.
author: Denis Waitley

text: The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you need inspiration, don't do it.
author: Elon Musk

text: Conquer the devils with a little thing called love.
author: Bob Marley

text: I skate to where the puck is going to be, not where it has been.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Art is the signature of civilizations.
author: Beverly Sills

text: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: It is your attitude, not your aptitude, that determines your altitude.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
author: Henry Ford

text: The more we have the less we own.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Our heart is a treasury; if you pour out all its wealth at once, you are bankrupt.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: A tiger doesn't lose sleep over the opinion of sheep.
author: Shahir Zag

text: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
author: Osho

text: You don't need to be better than anyone else, you just need to be better than you used to be.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.
author: James Cameron

text: Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success.
author: Henry Ford

text: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Most people achieved their greatest success one step beyond what looked like their greatest failure.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Never whine, never complain, never try to justify yourself.
author: Robert Greene

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.
author: Robert Greene

text: Never be bored, and you will never be boring.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Paths are made by walking.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Most people spend more time and energy going around problems than in trying to solve them.
author: Henry Ford

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: You are free, and that is why you are lost.
author: Franz Kafka

text: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

text: Faults are yours to fix, not to curse.
author: Colin Powell

text: Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!
author: Alfred Adler

text: Never do to others what you would not like them to do to you.
author: Confucius

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: Les Brown

text: The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: Life reflects your own thoughts back to you.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: No matter how qualified or deserving we are, we will never reach a better life until we can imagine it for ourselves and allow ourselves to have it.
author: Richard Bach

text: If light is in your heart, you will find your way home.
author: Rumi

text: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
author: George Washington

text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

text: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.
author: Dalai Lama

text: If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.
author: Alexander Pope

text: A dead thing can go with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.
author: William Faulkner

text: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Adversity is the tempering of one's mettle. Without it, we cannot know any true meaning in our accomplishments.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
author: James Matthew Barrie

text: From morning till night, we should never rely on a single thing.
author: Huang Po

text: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
author: Buddha

text: Life is simply what our feelings do to us.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: The first rule of handling conflict is don't hang around people who are constantly engaging in conflict.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Giving is living. If you stop wanting to give, there's nothing more to live for.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.
author: John Lennon

text: When the time is gone, you can never get it back.
author: Stephen King

text: Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.
author: Buddha

text: I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out; and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Absurdity is the ecstasy of intellectualism.
author: Criss Jami

text: Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.
author: John Tukey

text: Progress is limited by your ability to change your mind.
author: Jack Butcher

text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

text: The person who cannot control his words shows that he cannot control himself.
author: Robert Greene

text: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Be a master of change rather than a victim of change.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Life and the simple beauty of it is too good to pass up.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

text: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece
author: John Wooden

text: Numbing the pain for a while will only make it worse when you finally feel it.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Do anything, but let it produce joy.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Each path to knowledge involves different rules and these rules are not interchangeable.
author: Barack Obama

text: Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: When the world pushes you to your knees, you're in the perfect position to pray.
author: Rumi

text: People have the illusion that all over the world, all the time, all kinds of fantastic things are happening.
author: David Brinkley

text: Boldness makes even the smallest animal dangerous.
author: Robert Greene

text: Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: If you only knew the magnificence of the 3, 6, and 9, then you would have a key to the universe.
author: Nikola Tesla

text: Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: You play the hand you're dealt. I think the game's worthwhile.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: When one does not have what one wants, one must want what one has.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: When you realize you've made a mistake, take immediate steps to correct it.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Be content with what you have, rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

text: To be truly positive in the eyes of some, you have to risk appearing negative in the eyes of others.
author: Criss Jami

text: If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.
author: Unknown

text: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: If you look for perfection, you'll never be content.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Force has no place where there is need of skill.
author: Herodotus

text: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

text: Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
author: Seneca

text: Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: We all give up great expectations along the way.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Circumstances do not make the man, they reveal him.
author: James Allen

text: A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
author: Albert Einstein

text: When you have vision it affects your attitude. Your attitude is optimistic rather than pessimistic.
author: Charles Swindoll

text: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

text: Those who attain the middle Dominate the whole.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: What are we doing here, that is the question.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: When you say yes to change, you are choosing to navigate that path peacefully and happily and see where it takes you.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: We think too much and feel too little.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

text: Seek not the good in external things;seek it in yourselves.
author: Epictetus

text: A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.
author: Charles Dickens

text: I was wise enough to never grow up while fooling most people into believing I had.
author: Margaret Mead

text: It is better to light a single candle than to curse the darkness.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: You may think I'm small, but I have a universe inside my mind.
author: Yoko Ono

text: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.
author: Mark Twain

text: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Intelligent men are cruel. Stupid men are monstrously cruel.
author: Jack London

text: Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.
author: Dan Brown

text: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

text: Anyone telling you it's pointless to share your perspective is sharing their perspective.
author: Jack Butcher

text: When you want something in life, you just gotta reach out and grab it.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
author: St. Jerome

text: Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Many roads lead to the path, but basically there are only two: reason and practice.
author: Bodhidharma

text: All problems are illusions of the mind.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Play your part in life, but never forget that it is only a role.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: There is no excuse for not trying.
author: Barack Obama

text: You don't know who is important to you until you actually lose them.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The path is difficult to ensure worthiness. The lazy look elsewhere, The persevering find riches.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: You can only be afraid of what you think you know.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: I don't pretend to know everything; I just only speak on matters I know I'll win.
author: Criss Jami

text: Do something to move yourself toward your major goal every day.
author: Brian Tracy

text: The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Men learn to love the woman they are attracted to. Women learn to become attracted to the man they fall in love with.
author: Woody Allen

text: When the root is strong, the fruit is sweet.
author: Bob Marley

text: What you become is far more important than what you get.
author: Jim Rohn

text: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
author: John Lennon

text: Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
author: D. H. Lawrence

text: To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
author: Henry Ford

text: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: What do we live for if not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul.
author: Walt Whitman

text: The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple.
author: Alan Watts

text: Absurdity is the ecstasy of intellectualism.
author: Criss Jami

text: We cannot expect to be happy always... by experiencing evil as well as good we become wise.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.
author: Jim Rohn

text: It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
author: Tony Robbins

text: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

text: Your goals are the road maps that guide you and show you what is possible for your life.
author: Les Brown

text: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You can have the mind or you can have the moment.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Words are like Leaves; and where they most abound, Much Fruit of Sense beneath is rarely found.
author: Alexander Pope

text: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others succeed.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Leaders think and talk about solutions. Followers think and talk about the problems.
author: Brian Tracy

text: A man is but a product of his thoughts. What he thinks he becomes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

text: The happiest people in the world are those who feel absolutely terrific about themselves.
author: Brian Tracy

text: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
author: A.A. Milne

text: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: All wealth is the product of labor.
author: John Locke

text: Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: There are no uninteresting things, only uninterested people.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: You don't need to be better than anyone else, you just need to be better than you used to be.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Champions keep playing until they get it right.
author: Billie Jean King

text: It is in the darkness that one finds the light.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: To live is to be willing to die over and over again.
author: Pema Chodron

text: If what you're doing is not your passion, you have nothing to lose.
author: Celestine Chua

text: With self-discipline, almost anything is possible.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
author: Mark Twain

text: Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Heroes don't need to talk about what they did.
author: W.P. Kinsella

text: Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.
author: Unknown

text: If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Life is a challenge, meet it! Life is a dream, realize it! Life is a game, play it! Life is love, enjoy it!
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Wrong turns are as important as right turns. More important, sometimes.
author: Richard Bach

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Lao Tzu

text: To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Life is the dancer and you are the dance.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little; do something.
author: Sydney Smith

text: Judgments prevent us from seeing the good that lies beyond appearances.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: An un-examined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: The most virtuous are those who content themselves with being virtuous without seeking to appear so.
author: Plato

text: It's your life-but only if you make it so.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Prefer to be defeated in the presence of the wise than to excel among fools.
author: Dogen

text: If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
author: Zhuangzi

text: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goals.
author: Sydney Smith

text: Art is the signature of civilizations.
author: Beverly Sills

text: How to get more opportunity: Create more opportunity for others.
author: Jack Butcher

text: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Life reflects your own thoughts back to you.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: It is best to begin at the beginning.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: A flower falls, even though we love it; and a weed grows, even though we do not love it.
author: Dogen

text: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The opportunity of defeating the enemy is provided by the enemy himself.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
author: Judy Garland

text: You already have every characteristic necessary for success if you recognize, claim, develop and use them.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Talk does not cook rice.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: It isn't what you do, but how you do it.
author: John Wooden

text: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.
author: Steve Jobs

text: To forget the whole world is easy; to make the whole world forget you is hard.
author: Zhuangzi

text: The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
author: George Washington

text: If you focus on results and finding shortcuts, you'll get impatient. If you focus on the process and doing the right thing, you'll be unstoppable.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: You live by what you thrill to, and there's the end of it.
author: D. H. Lawrence

text: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
author: Henry Ford

text: There is no absolute success in the world, only constant progress.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: No matter what happens, always be yourself.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
author: Colin Powell

text: Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.
author: Og Mandino

text: Many answers to what you seek don't lie 'out there'. If you look inwards, you'll find the answer has been in you all along.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

text: You are not one person, but three: The one you think you are; The one others think you are; The one you really are.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: We have more possibilities available in each moment than we realize.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: If you genuinely want something, don't wait for it - teach yourself.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Constantly think about how you could be doing things better.
author: Elon Musk

text: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

text: Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: You cannot find peace avoiding life.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
author: Alan Watts

text: Where violence reigns, reason is weak.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Paths are made by walking.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small.
author: Lao Tzu

text: How you think when you lose determines how long it will be until you win.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: If you are going to achieve excellence in big things, you develop the habit in little matters.
author: Colin Powell

text: No matter how qualified or deserving we are, we will never reach a better life until we can imagine it for ourselves and allow ourselves to have it.
author: Richard Bach

text: Circumstances rule men; men do not rule circumstances.
author: Herodotus

text: If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart.
author: Buddha

text: People don't realize that now is all there ever is; there is no past or future except as memory or anticipation in your mind.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.
author: John Wooden

text: Life goes by very fast. And the worst thing in life that you can have is a job that you hate, and have no energy and creativity in.
author: Robert Greene

text: The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it.
author: Genghis Khan

text: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: The wiser you get, the less you care to look like a fool.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: Passion is born deaf and dumb.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
author: Richard Bach

text: Think and wonder, wonder and think.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: We are born from a quiet sleep, and we die to a calm awakening
author: Zhuangzi

text: It is what we make out of what we have, not what we are given, that separates one person from another.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
author: Henry Ford

text: Most people achieved their greatest success one step beyond what looked like their greatest failure.
author: Brian Tracy

text: We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.
author: Sydney Smith

text: Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.
author: Confucius

text: When uncomfortable, my instinct is not to avoid the discomfort but to become at peace with it.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: Living life in style also means living a life of balance.
author: Jim Rohn

text: A thing must be loved before it is lovable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: The harder you work, the harder it is to surrender.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: It doesn't matter how much you want. What really matters is how much you want it.
author: Ralph Marston

text: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
author: James Allen

text: Poverty and hardship are created by false thinking.
author: Bodhidharma

text: If someone betrays you once, it's their fault; if they betray you twice, it's your fault.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Relax. Nothing is under control.
author: Adi Da Samraj

text: Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Confidence is the greatest friend.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Words are the clothing of our thoughts.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: I believe that potential is unlimited - success depends on daring to act on dreams.
author: Estee Lauder

text: The whole world is a series of miracles, but we're so used to them we call them ordinary things.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Never whine, never complain, never try to justify yourself.
author: Robert Greene

text: For things to change, you have to change.
author: Jim Rohn

text: You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Stuff your eyes with wonder... live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option.
author: Mark Twain

text: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

text: The biggest adventure is what lies ahead.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
author: Tony Robbins

text: All that a man achieves and all that he fails to achieve is the direct result of his own thoughts.
author: James Allen

text: Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: The goal is not to show how great you are to others, but how vulnerable you are to yourself.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something.
author: Barack Obama

text: It is passion that makes man live; wisdom makes one only last.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that things are difficult.
author: Seneca

text: Life is not just the passing of time. Life is the collection of experiences and their intensity.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
author: Babe Ruth

text: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Leadership is solving problems
author: Colin Powell

text: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
author: David Brinkley

text: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
author: Seneca

text: Faith means believing the unbelievable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Anyone who has ever made anything of importance was disciplined.
author: Andrew Hendrixson

text: I would rather be a little nobody, then to be an evil somebody.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Don't be afraid to go slowly. Be afraid of stopping.
author: Zen Proverb

text: You are not stuck where you are unless you decide to be.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Associate yourself with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

text: People acting together as a group can accomplish things which no individual acting alone could ever hope to bring about.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Experience is a comb which nature gives us when we are bald.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: If light is in your heart, you will find your way home.
author: Rumi

text: Life is a succession of lessons, which must be lived to be understood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The busy man is never wise and the wise man is never busy.
author: Lin Yutang

text: He who possesses most must be most afraid of loss.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: As mortals, we're ruled by conditions, not by ourselves.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Surround yourself with only people who are going to lift you higher.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: It is easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them.
author: Alfred Adler

text: I have lost friends, some by death...others by sheer inability to cross the street.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
author: John Lennon

text: Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: When you've got nothing, you've got nothing to lose.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Take interest and even delight in doing the small things well.
author: Jim Rohn

text: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

text: One of the most difficult things is not to change society - but to change yourself.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
author: Dalai Lama

text: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Discipline yourself, and others won't need to.
author: John Wooden

text: If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Every defeat, every heartbreak every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.
author: Og Mandino

text: If you do not push the boundaries, you will never know where they are.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
author: Denis Waitley

text: The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Giving is living. If you stop wanting to give, there's nothing more to live for.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
author: W. Clement Stone

text: I can think of nothing less pleasurable than a life devoted to pleasure.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Is it really possible to tell someone else what one feels?
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Move out of your comfort zone. You can only grow if you are willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.
author: Dan Brown

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Watch what you say, and whaterver you say, practice it.
author: Soyen Shaku

text: We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: I don't ever give up. I'd have to be dead or completely incapacitated.
author: Elon Musk

text: The problem happens when we have multiple desires. When we have fuzzy desires. When we want to do ten different things and we're not clear about which is the one we care about.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.
author: Will Rogers

text: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
author: Robert Frost

text: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
author: Voltaire

text: Natural talent only determines the limits of your athletic potential. It's dedication and a willingness to discipline your life that makes you great.
author: Billie Jean King

text: Over time, loneliness gets inside you and doesn't go away.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Magic is believing in yourself, if you can do that, you can make anything happen.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
author: Richard Bach

text: You have to make time, even for something as universal as staring at the stars.
author: W.P. Kinsella

text: The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.
author: Tony Robbins

text: It is not what we get. But who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Either get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: We have to live life with a sense of urgency so not a minute is wasted.
author: Les Brown

text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

text: Anyone who reads a book with a sense of obligation does not understand the art of reading.
author: Lin Yutang

text: I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
author: Estee Lauder

text: I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.
author: Judy Garland

text: Learning is a weightless treasure you can always carry easily.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

text: To be great is to be misunderstood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: In the middle of chaos lies opportunity.
author: Bruce Lee

text: It is only depth of character that determines the profundity with which we face life.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Small men think they are small; great men never know they are great.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: All leaders are readers.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
author: Celestine Chua

text: A Hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.
author: Lao Tzu

text: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
author: Mark Twain

text: Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: A wise man makes his own decisions, but an ignorant man mindlessly follows the crowd.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Try all things, hold fast that which is good.
author: John Locke

text: Winning isn't everything, but wanting to win is.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Everyone sees what you appear to be, few experience what you really are.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: In order to be walked over, you have to be lying down.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Ripe fruit falls by itself - but it doesn't fall in your mouth.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: We create the world and ourselves;
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Without the rain there would be no rainbow.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Conscience is a man's compass.
author: Vincent van Gogh
